page.title: 11Winmarleigh Village School
page.content: Winmarleigh C.E.School was built at the time of 1870 Education Act.It rep- laced a 'Master's School' which eludes all attempts to trace it. For the first 80 years the village children received all their education here save for the few who gained free place scholarships at Lancaster Royal or Girl's Grammar Schools. The school is currently in a trough with but 19 pupils on roll (49 twelve years ago).The national declining roll is exagerated here as the population is cyclic in nature and a generation ago the same problem was present. There are but 36 or so children under 11 in the village and discounting 2 in private education,2 in R.C. school and the 19 on roll the problem is great. This year saw the staving off of clos- ure at the 11th hour for the 2nd time in recent years.
